body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in southern Wales, formerly called the Brecon Beacons National Park:
examples: The Bannau Brycheiniog National Park Visitor Centre is just 5 minutes off the A470 at the village of Libanus.
The hedgerows restoration project is managed by The Bannau Brycheiniog National Park Authority.
